wikipedia_page.main: Clement Vavasor Durell (born 6 June 1882, Fulbourn, Cambridgeshire, died South Africa, 10 December 1968) was an English schoolmaster who wrote mathematical textbooks.

response: * C. V. Durell – schoolmaster, mathematician and textbook author (6 June 1882, Fulbourn – 10 December 1968 South Africa)

As background on the geometry covered in this book, reviewer R. P. Burn suggests two other books, Modern Geometry: The Straight Line and Circle by C. V. Durell, and Geometry: A Comprehensive Course by Daniel Pedoe.
* C. V. Durell (1882–1968), schoolmaster who wrote mathematical textbooks.
C. V. Durell, world best selling author of books on mathematics including "School Certificate Algebra" (1958)
*C. V. Durell – writer of mathematics textbooks

link_mentions.page: List of masters of Gresham's School
response: *C. V. Durell (assistant master, 1904–05), writer of mathematics textbooksOxford Dictionary of National Biography (Oxford University Press, 2004)
* C. V. Durell, (1882–1968), mathematician, prolific writer of school text books (ODNB)

Quadling was head-hunted as a textbook writer at the Mathematical Association conference in 1955, by the authors C. V. Durell and Alan Robson (Marlborough College), and A. V. Ready of George Bell & Sons. There resulted his books on mechanics with A. R. D. Ramsay, also of Marlborough. His textbooks are noted for their mathematical rigour and thoroughness, and their attention to practical application.
